meanings.definition: A group of individuals of the same species living together in a close-knit community.
meanings.sent1: The semicolony of ants worked together to build their nest.
meanings.sent2: The bird semicolony nested in the tall tree, chirping happily.
meanings.sent3: The semicolony of bees threw a buzzing party in their hive.
meanings.sent4: The semicolony of penguins waddled in unison, like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The semicolony of fish swam gracefully in the clear waters, a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A punctuation mark used to separate independent clauses in a sentence.
meanings.sent1: In her essay, she used a semicolony to connect related ideas.
meanings.sent2: The writer added a semicolony to join the two independent clauses seamlessly.
meanings.sent3: The semicolony on the page winked mischievously at the comma nearby.
meanings.sent4: His writing style was like a dance, each semicolony a graceful twirl.
meanings.sent5: The semicolony stood out on the paper, demanding attention with its unique shape.
